arm_group.description: Healthy adults above the age of 18 years
Adult patients above the age of 18 years with gastric, colorectal (including pre-cancer polyps) or pancreatic cancer

brief_summary.textblock:
Colorectal cancers account for 783,000 new cases and cause 437,000 deaths per year across
      the world. Diagnosis in the early stages improves survival rates. Up to now, these cancers
      are mostly diagnosed only at later stages of the disease's course through histoimmune
      staining and molecular biology processes on the tissues biopsied from the gastrointestinal
      system under invasive diagnostic procedures of colonoscopy.

      Oral fluid presents a large protein complexity and has been recently used as a diagnostic
      biofluid for oral, as well as systematic diseases. Using oral fluid as a bio-marker for the
      colorectal cancer can be advantageous as it contains gastrointestinal fluids, in addition to
      bacteria and bacteria lysate, which can also serve as a bio-markers' source for colorectal
      cancers. Proteomic technologies provide the tools needed to discover and identify
      disease-associated biomarkers.

      The aim of the present study is to identify salivary bio-markers in patients suffering from
      colorectal cancers.

clinical_study.brief_title: Identifying Saliva Markers of Patients With Stomach, Colorectal (Including Pre-cancer Polyp) and Pancreatic Cancers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Has not yet started treatment for the identified cancer

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  medically compromised patients

          -  congenital syndromes

          -  being treated with radiotherapy or chemotherapy.

study_pop.textblock:
Patients identified with gastric, colorectal (including pre-cancer polyps) or pancreatic
        cancer

intervention.description: Each participant will give a sample of saliva through spitting for 10 minutes in a sterile tube.
